oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Practical approaches to on-farm pain management in cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kleinhenz, Michael
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dehorn
castration
analgesia
NSAID
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cattle experience pain following routine husbandry proce­dures including castration and dehorning. Despite the lack of approved analgesics for cattle in the United States, veterinar­ians can still provide analgesic regimens to cattle undergoing painful procedures. Knowledge of available medications, data supporting use, and the ability to establish safe meat and milk withhold intervals are required.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2021 Annual Conference Proceedings; 217-221
